page.title: 03CHESHIRE DIALECT
page.content:
PLACE NAMES: A lot of place names have been changed. Aulem is now Audlem Autringhem is now Altrincham Yorzic is now Eordswick Mebberly is now Mobberly Woreum is now Weaverham. But some places like Cholmondy (which is pronouced 'chumly') have stayed more or less the same.
PROVERBS: The county holds many special proverbs and sayings:- A cock fights best on his own bonk Better bad than bowt (without) Beter wed over the mixen (marry the girl next door rather than the one from the next county) A pretty girl is soon kissed. Foxes are all tail and women are all
